definition[0]: to be replaced by something else
example[0]: Stone has given way to glass and concrete.
example[1]: My anger gave way to depression.
definition[1]: to agree to do what someone else wants, instead of what you want, especially after a lot of discussion or argument
example[2]: Despite growing pressure, the Minister of State refused to give way.
example[3]: Maria seemed to despise him for giving way to her.
definition[2]: to break because of too much weight or pressure
example[4]: The floorâ€™s rotten and likely to give way.
definition[3]: to stop or slow down when you are driving, in order to allow other vehicles to go first
example[5]: In Britain, give way to cars coming from the right.
